definition: a sour substance, any of various typically water-soluble and sour compounds that in solution are capable of reacting with a base (see base entry 1 sense 6a) to form a salt, redden litmus, and have a pH less than 7, that are hydrogen-containing molecules or ions able to give up a proton to a base, or that are substances able to accept an unshared pair of electrons from a base

examples: a social satire dripping with acid

definition: sour, sharp, or biting to the taste
sharp, biting, or sour in manner, disposition, or nature
of, relating to, or being an acid, having the reactions or characteristics of an acid
derived by partial exchange of replaceable hydrogen
containing or involving the use of an acid (as in manufacture)
marked by or resulting from an abnormally high concentration of acid
relating to or made by a process in which the furnace is lined with acidic material and an acidic slag is used
